title: Unraveling Atomic-Scale Reconstruction at the Interface: A Novel Insight into Epitaxial Growth Mechanism of Metallic Delafossite Thin Films
content: Delafossites are known as oxides of the general chemical composition ABO2, containing metal ions in the formal oxidation state of A+ and B3+ [1]. Depending on the A- and B-site cations, delafossite oxides exhibit a variety of interesting physical properties. These include p-type or bipolar semiconductivity (for A = Cu, B = Al, Cr, Fe, Ga, Y, In), photocatalytic activity (e.g. AgGaO2), multiferroicity (CuFeO2), and metallic conductivity (PdCoO2, PdCrO2, PdRhO2, PtCoO2, and AgNiO2) [2].
